gurmukhi: puAMq pwrbqI isrM ncMq eIsxo rxM ] BkMq BUq pRyqxo bkMq bIr bYqlM ]797]
transliteration: Puant Paarbatisiran Nachannd Eesano Ranan|| Bhakant Bhoot Pretano Bekant Beer Baitlan||797||
translation: It seemed that Shiva, the lord of Parvati, was engaged in Tandava dance in the battlefield. The heinous shouts of ghosts, fiends and brave Vaitals are being heard.797.

gurmukhi: ju`ty vIrM ] Cu`ty qIrM ] Pu`ty AMgM ] qu`ty qMgM ]798]
transliteration: Joutte Vderan|| Chhoutte Tderan|| Phoutte Anadg|| Toutte Tanadg||798||
translation: The warriors began to fight, the arrows were showered, the limbs were chopped and the saddles of the horses were torn.798.

gurmukhi: B`gy vIrM ] l`gy qIrM ] ip`Ky rwmM ] DrmM DwmM ]799]
transliteration: Bhagge Vderan|| Lagge Tderan|| Pikkhe Raamannd|| Dharamannd Dhaamannd||799||
translation: The warriors began to run on being shot by arrows; the sbode of Dharma (Ram) saw all this.799.

gurmukhi: ju`Jy joDM ] m`cy kRoDM ] bMDo bwlM ] bIr auqwlM ]800]
transliteration: Jujjhe Jodhan|| Machche Krodhan|| Bandho Baalan|| Beer Outaalan||800||
translation: Being enraged the warriors began to fight and said, “Arrest and bind these boys quickly.”800.

gurmukhi: Fu`ky Pyr ] il`ny Gyr ] vIrYN bwl ] ijau dÍYkwl ]801]
transliteration: Dhoukke Pher|| Linne Gher|| Veerain Baal|| Jio Dvaikaal||801||
translation: The soldiers rushed forth and besieged both the death-like radiant boy.801.

gurmukhi: q`jI kwx ] mwry bwx ] if`gy vIr ] B`gy DIr ]802]
transliteration: Tajjikan|| Mdare Baan|| Digge Veer|| Bhagge Dheer||802||
translation: The boys fearlessly discharged arrows with which the warriors fell and very enduring ones fled away.802.

gurmukhi: k`ty AMg ] if`gy jMg ] su`DM sUr ] iB`ny nUr ]803]
transliteration: Katte An|| Digge Jan|| Suddhan Soor|| Bhinne Noor||803||
translation: The warriors of chopped limbs fell in the field, they were looking extremely magnificent.803.

gurmukhi: l`KY nwih ] B`gy jwih ] q`jy rwm ] DrmM Dwm ]804]
transliteration: Lakhai Naah(i) Bhagge Jaah(i)|| Tajje Raam|| Dharamannd Dhaam||804||
translation: They are running away without seeing anything; they are leaving even Ram, the abode of Dharma.804.

gurmukhi: AaurY Bys ] Ku`ly kys ] ssqRM Cor ] dY dY kor ]805]
transliteration: Aurai Bhes|| Khulle Kes|| Sastran Chhodh|| Dai Dai Kor||805||
translation: The warriors, disguising themselves, loosening their hair and forsaking their weapons, are running away by the sides of the battlefield.805.

gurmukhi: duhUM idsn joDw hrY prXo ju`D duAY jwm ] jUJ skl sYnw geI rihgy eykl rwm ]806]
transliteration: Duhoon Disan Jodhaa Darai Daryo Juddh Duai Jaam|| Joojh Sakal Sainaa Gadraihge Ekal Raam||806||
translation: The warriors of both sides were killed and for two pehars (about six houts) the war continued; all the forces of Ram were killed and now he survived alone.806.

gurmukhi: iqhU BRwq ibnu BU hnXo Ar sB dlih sMGwr ] lv Ar kus jUJn inimq lIny rwm hkwr ]807]
transliteration: Tihoo Bhraat Bin(u) Bhoo Hanyo Ar Sabh Dalab(i) Sanhaar|| Lava R Kous Joojhan Nimit Leene Raam Hakaar||807||
translation: Lava and Kusha killed the three brothers and their forces fearlessly and now they challenged Ram.807.

gurmukhi: sYnw skl juJwie kY kiq bYTy Cp jwie ] Ab hm so qumhUM lro suin suin kausl rwie ]808]
transliteration: Sainaa Sakal Jujhaae-kai Kat(i) Baithe Chhap Jaae|| Ab Ham So Toum-hoon Daro Soun(i) Soun(i) Kaousal Raae||808||
translation: The boys (of the sage) said to Ram, “O, the King of Kaushal! You have got all your army killed and where are you hiding now? Now come and fight with us.”808.
